intro: Pilosella lithuanica, commonly known as the Lithuanian hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe, including Lithuania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white or pale yellow ray florets. Pilosella lithuanica is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is considered a rare species in some regions.
